page.title: 08Farming in Magor
page.content: Magor is an excellant site for farming because the ground is very flat.Five hundred years ago the monks from Tinten Abbey drained the land. Farmers still drain the land today. Beef and dairy farming are the main forms of agriculture practiced in the area. Beef is the main form of produce.The cows are fattened then slaughtered for their meat. Dairy farmers milk their cows twice a day and take the milk to St.Mellons. In the summer the farmer cuts a grass crop called Silage for his cows to eat during the winter,he also grows hay. Grain crops are also grown,they are Barley ,Wheat and Maize.Combine harvesters come around and cut the crops.It's because of the large machines such as combine harvesters that fields have been made bigger.
